identificationModule.briefTitle: Fluid Oriented Therapy During Major Abdominal Surgery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect Of Stroke Volume Optimization On Complication Rate Of Patients Undergoing Pancreatic Surgery

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In this "before and after" study we will investigate the potential benefit on postoperative outcomes of a guided fluid therapy with a stroke volume optimization . The NICE protocol has been applied by means of EV1000 monitor and arterial waveform analysis ( Flotrac - Edwards). In the postoperative period overall complications, as well as exitus , will be analyzed and compared with those of a control group underwent the same surgical interventions, with a standard hemodynamic monitoring.

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: patients before 2014, in which fluids were administered without FloTrac monitoring

armGroups.label: case group
armGroups.description: patients after 2014, after management of fluid therapy has been guided by FloTrac parameters as a standard clinical practice (NICE protocol)

interventions.name: FloTrac
interventions.description: Stroke Volume has been maintained at 90% of the maximal Stroke Volume as in NICE protocol 2011
